medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms began approximately 1 year before evaluation with pain in her right shoulder and scapula, followed by cough and an episode of hemoptysis. Over time, antibiotic treatment for pneumonia did not relieve the pain or radiographic abnormalities. Before evaluation, computed tomography revealed an irregular mass in the right upper lobe and multiple pleural nodules. Pain worsened two months before evaluation, particularly after erlotinib was discontinued.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Metastatic (stage IV) non-small-cell lung carcinoma; previous gynecologic and bladder surgery.
medical_history.social_history: The patient lived with her husband and teenaged children, worked in an office, drank alcohol infrequently, and had never smoked or used illicit drugs.
